title: Anjaneri Hills
subtitle: Mythological Hill and Birthplace of Lord Hanuman
overview: Anjaneri Hills, located near Nashik in Maharashtra, holds immense mythological and cultural significance as the birthplace of Lord Hanuman.
Situated at an altitude of about 1,300 meters, Anjaneri is part of the Trimbakeshwar mountain range in the Western Ghats.
The region is also a popular trekking destination, offering panoramic views of the surrounding valleys and Trimbakeshwar temple town.

highlights.title: Birthplace of Lord Hanuman
highlights.description: Anjaneri is revered as the birthplace of Lord Hanuman, making it a sacred pilgrimage for devotees.

highlights.title: Scenic Trek and Panoramic Views
highlights.description: A moderately challenging trek rewards you with breathtaking views of the Trimbak range and lush landscapes.

geography.intro: Anjaneri is a part of the Trimbakeshwar mountain range and lies in the Sahyadri region of Nashik district. The terrain is rugged yet scenic, with basalt rock formations and rolling hills.

climate.description: Anjaneri enjoys a pleasant climate most of the year. Monsoon enhances its beauty with greenery and mist-covered hills.

seasons.text: Monsoon (June–September): Ideal for trekking and photography with lush green surroundings.
Winter (November–February): Pleasant and cool weather for temple visits and exploration.

geography.conclusion: Anjaneri’s geographical blend of mythological sites and natural beauty makes it a must-visit for both spiritual seekers and trekkers.

activities.title: Trekking to Anjaneri Fort
activities.description: A 2-3 hour moderate trek leading to the ancient Anjaneri Fort and cave temples.
info: The trail passes through scenic plateaus and steps cut into rocks.
Best enjoyed early morning for cool temperatures and sunrise views.

activities.title: Pilgrimage Visit
activities.description: Devotees visit the Anjaneri Mata Temple, dedicated to the mother of Lord Hanuman.
info: Temple located near the top of the hill.
Festivals like Hanuman Jayanti are celebrated with great devotion.

activities.title: Nature Photography
activities.description: Capture panoramic valley views, rock formations, and temple structures.
info: Carry a wide-angle lens for landscapes.
Avoid monsoon fog if you want clear shots.

attractions.title: Anjaneri Mata Temple
attractions.description: A sacred temple dedicated to Anjani Mata, mother of Lord Hanuman, located atop the hill.

attractions.title: Anjaneri Caves
attractions.description: Ancient caves believed to be from the Satavahana period, located near the trekking route.
attractions.value: Ideal for exploring ancient rock-cut structures.

marineLife.intro: Being a hill region, Anjaneri does not feature marine life, but its forest ecosystem supports rich biodiversity.

items.title: Birdlife
items.description: Species like peacocks, parakeets, and bulbuls are often sighted during treks.

items.title: Wildlife
items.description: Monkeys, langurs, and small reptiles inhabit the forested slopes.

conclusion: Anjaneri is a tranquil ecological zone supporting native flora and fauna.
The region forms part of the Western Ghats biodiversity corridor.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Located around 20 km from Nashik and 160 km from Mumbai.
Regular buses and taxis are available from Nashik city to Anjaneri village base.

howToReach.title: By Train & Air
details: Nearest railway station: Nashik Road (30 km).
Nearest airport: Ozar Airport, Nashik (40 km).

bookingTips.description: Wear sturdy shoes — the trail can be steep and slippery during monsoon.
Carry rain protection during monsoon treks and a water bottle for hydration.
Early morning is best for photography and panoramic views of the valley.
